The cardinals of the ~NAME2` tower have emerged from their seclusion. As ~COLOUR` smoke leaves the top of the tower, a crowd starts to gather outside. The announcement is made, the cardinals have chosen YOU to be the new ~LEADER-NAME` of the ~IDENTITY`.

Acolytes stand around the body of ~LEADER-NAME` ~NAME2` as prayers are said. A gong sounds as the crowd stands up in unison to face YOU, the designated successor to be the next ~LEADER-NAME` of the ~IDENTITY`.

As the faithful dance faster and faster around the great fire, ~NAME2` the elder turns to face you. Chants fill the air as he smears ~COLOUR` paint onto your face to mark YOU as the ~LEADER-NAME` of the ~IDENTITY`.

The cardinals of the ~NAME2` tower have emerged from their seclusion. As ~COLOUR` smoke leaves the top of the tower, a crowd starts to gather outside. The announcement is made, the cardinals have chosen YOU to be the new ~LEADER-NAME` of the ~IDENTITY`.

As the faithful dance faster and faster around the great fire, ~NAME2` the elder turns to face you. Chants fill the air as he smears ~COLOUR` paint onto your face to mark YOU as the ~LEADER-NAME` of the ~IDENTITY`.

The master counters, safely locked inside ~NAME2` Hall have finished counting all the votes. People anxiously try to anticipate the result by reading the expressions on the master counters' faces as they stream out onto the balcony to proclaim that YOU have won the election and are now the next ~LEADER-NAME` of the ~IDENTITY`.

Umpires run across the field trying to keep up with you. Your fingers frantically dig into the soil as you climb the ~NAME2` hill to the base of the square ~COLOUR` stone that holds the Sword. An umpire sounds a horn as you lift the Sword clear above your head. The crowd applauds wildly as your challengers collapse on the ground, exhausted. YOU are the ~LEADER-NAME` of the ~IDENTITY`.

A timid knock sounds on your door, it opens as ~NAME2` pokes his head in. It is the news you have been expecting. Your father, the ~LEADER-NAME` is dead. You raise your head and hold your breath. ~NAME2` opens the ~COLOUR` door wide open and bows his head. YOU must carry on you father's legacy, LONG LIVE THE ~LEADER-NAME` of the ~IDENTITY`!

Welcome, Atalaster. You have found yourself in charge of a group of your people, banded together by a common heritage or belief system. You must guide their activities in a wild and unforgiving world. Develop your land and set your people to work producing goods for sale in the world market. With the help of foreigners and your wise council, you can increase your numbers and expand into new lands.

Welcome, Atalaster. You have found yourself in charge of a group of your people, banded together by a common heritage or belief system. You must guide their activities in a wild and unforgiving world. Develop your land and set your people to work producing goods for sale in the world market. With the help of foreigners and your wise council, you can increase your numbers and expand into new lands.

Welcome, Atalaster. You have found yourself in charge of a group of your people, banded together by a common heritage or belief system. You must guide their activities in a wild and unforgiving world. Develop your land and set your people to work producing goods for sale in the world market. With the help of foreigners and your wise council, you can increase your numbers and expand into new lands.

There are many goods to trade in Atalaster. There are six main categories of goods for sale in the world market and kept in your store. Food is eaten by people around the world, it is essential for population growth. Upper and middle classes also need goods, everyday essentials for use in the home. Luxuries are consumed by the upper echelons of society.

 

Primary resources generally have no direct use, but are used to create other resources. Secondary resources are also used in the creation of other resources, or for other purposes like trade, war and construction. Agricultural resources include crops and animals that are used to produce other goods. The price of each resource is determined by is availability. Resources produced in excess of their use will cheapen over time and those that are used up faster than they can be produced will tend to get more expensive.

Luxuries are consumed by the upper echelons of society.

Primary resources generally have no direct use, but are used to create other resources. Agricultural resources include crops and animals that are used to produce other goods. The price of each resource is determined by is availability. Resources produced in excess of their use will cheapen over time and those that are used up faster than they can be produced will tend to get more expensive.

Are you hungry, Atalaster? There are ten major foods eaten in the world. Every person in the world must eat one unit of food every day to survive. People will consume up to five units a day to feed their children and will stockpile food in their kitchens.

Are you hungry, Atalaster? There are ten major foods eaten in the world. Every person in the world must eat one unit of food every day to survive. People will consume up to five units a day to feed their children and will stockpile food in their kitchens.

Are you hungry, Atalaster? There are ten major foods eaten in the world. Every person in the world must eat one unit of food every day to survive. People will consume up to five units a day to feed their children and will stockpile food in their kitchens.

Rice is an essential staple for many cultures. A cereal grain that is grown in a variety of climates, but particularly in flooded plantations where pests like animals and other plants cannot thrive. Rice is best grown on wetlands, it does well in jungles and can even be grown in limited amounts in forests.

Rice is an essential staple for many cultures. A cereal grain that is grown in a variety of climates, but particularly in flooded plantations where pests like animals and other plants cannot thrive. Rice is best grown on wetlands, it does well in jungles and can even be grown in limited amounts in forests.

Rice is an essential staple for many cultures. A cereal grain that is grown in a variety of climates, but particularly in flooded plantations where pests like animals and other plants cannot thrive. Rice is best grown on wetlands, it does well in jungles and can even be grown in limited amounts in forests.

Fruit is an umbrella term for the various produce of flowering trees that constitute part of a healthy diet. Pears, apples and citrus fruit, as well as olives, dates, tomatoes and grapes, the hundreds of fruit varieties are an essential part of everyone's diet. Fruit is grown on farms, and does particularly well in hills. It also grows in wetlands and grasslands and even in plains.

Fruit is an umbrella term for the various produce of flowering trees that constitute part of a healthy diet. Pears, apples and citrus fruit, as well as olives, dates, tomatoes and grapes, the hundreds of fruit varieties are an essential part of everyone's diet. Fruit is grown on farms, and does particularly well in hills. It also grows in wetlands and grasslands and even in plains.

Fruit is an umbrella term for the various produce of flowering trees that constitute part of a healthy diet. Pears, apples and citrus fruit, as well as olives, dates, tomatoes and grapes, the hundreds of fruit varieties are an essential part of everyone's diet. Fruit is grown on farms, and does particularly well in hills. It also grows in wetlands and grasslands and even in plains.

Yes, Atalaster, every venture such as yours has a store. Here you keep the goods you buy from abroad and things that are produced within your lands. There are six groups of goods, the consumables; food, goods and luxuries and other goods used for various purposes like trade, war, construction and the production of other goods.

 

At the store you can set the level of each good. Every game day, your traders will buy goods to reach the level you hae set for each type of good. Any goods that are in excess of the limit, after your people have produced them, will be sold on the world market. The maximum level of each good is determined by the efforts of your merchants in your council.

There are six groups of goods, the consumables; food, goods and luxuries and other goods used for various purposes like trade, war, construction and the production of other goods.

Any goods that are in excess of the limit, after your people have produced them, will be sold on the world market. The maximum level of each good is determined by the efforts of your merchants in your council.

There are six groups of goods, the consumables; food, goods and luxuries and other goods used for various purposes like trade, war, construction and the production of other goods.

 

At the store you can set the level of each good. Every game day, your traders will buy goods to reach the level you hae set for each type of good. Any goods that are in excess of the limit, after your people have produced them, will be sold on the world market. The maximum level of each good is determined by the efforts of your merchants in your council.

It is a small world, Atalaster. All of the peoples in the world are connected and guided in their activities by the price system. Goods produced in excess will eventually become cheaper just as if the demand for a good is higher than its produciton, its price will rise with time. Keep a close eye on prices as the profitability of your lands depends on the prices paid for the goods they produce.

 

As the price for a good collapses, leaders around the world will direct their people away from the unprofitable venture and use their resources to product other goods. Savvy leaders can stockpile cheap goods in their stores and sell them for a profit once the price recovers at a later date. Make sure your people are producing the most valuable goods that their skills, technology and lands allow.

Scan the horizon and look upon your lands, Atalaster. These lands can be developed by constructing goods producing buildings on them. Each developed land can put a production recipe into practice. Different lands allow for different developments to be constructed and certain recipes are much more effective on some lands than others.

Scan the horizon and look upon your lands, Atalaster. These lands can be developed by constructing goods producing buildings on them. Each developed land can put a production recipe into practice. Different lands allow for different developments to be constructed and certain recipes are much more effective on some lands than others.

Scan the horizon and look upon your lands, Atalaster. These lands can be developed by constructing goods producing buildings on them. Each developed land can put a production recipe into practice. Different lands allow for different developments to be constructed and certain recipes are much more effective on some lands than others.

From thick dark forests to lighter rolling woodlands, forests provide a varied environment that can provide plenty of fuel and construction material. Wild animals can be found and hunted in forests and they can even be used for some limited cultivation. A forest can be developed by building a furnace, which takes advantage of the plentiful fuel. Camps provide a base for hunters who hunt the various forest game and plantations can take advantage of the good climate and rich soils. Mills are often located in forests which can be situated near to the lumberjacks' camps. Closed off structures like barns can also be built, making forests some of the most versatile land types around.

From thick dark forests to lighter rolling woodlands, forests provide a varied environment that can provide plenty of fuel and construction material. Closed off structures like barns can also be built, making forests some of the most versatile land types around.

Wild animals can be found and hunted in forests and they can even be used for some limited cultivation. A forest can be developed by building a furnace, which takes advantage of the plentiful fuel. Camps provide a base for hunters who hunt the various forest game and plantations can take advantage of the good climate and rich soils. Mills are often located in forests which can be situated near to the lumberjacks' camps. Closed off structures like barns can also be built, making forests some of the most versatile land types around.

Lands can be improved by constructing one development. There are eleven types of developements, farms, mills, furnaces, workshops, camps, barns, plantations, mines, quarries, pastures and slaughterhouses. Once developed, people can be hired form the labour pool to work the land using one of the available recipes that is in your library.

There are eleven types of developements, farms, mills, furnaces, workshops, camps, barns, plantations, mines, quarries, pastures and slaughterhouses. Once developed, people can be hired form the labour pool to work the land using one of the available recipes that is in your library.

Lands can be improved by constructing one development. There are eleven types of developements, farms, mills, furnaces, workshops, camps, barns, plantations, mines, quarries, pastures and slaughterhouses. Once developed, people can be hired form the labour pool to work the land using one of the available recipes that is in your library.

Plantations are intensive cultivation operations in hot and humid climates. They allow for the labour-intensive primary resource extraction jobs of growing rice, sugar, spices, silk, cotton and honey. they can be build in jungles, forests and wetlands.

Plantations are intensive cultivation operations in hot and humid climates. They allow for the labour-intensive primary resource extraction jobs of growing rice, sugar, spices, silk, cotton and honey. they can be build in jungles, forests and wetlands.

Plantations are intensive cultivation operations in hot and humid climates. They allow for the labour-intensive primary resource extraction jobs of growing rice, sugar, spices, silk, cotton and honey. they can be build in jungles, forests and wetlands.

What are you doing, Atalaster? Every method of producing any resource is codified into a recipe. A recipe consists of a number of parts:

 

  1. Inputs
    While recipes for the extraction of primary resources have no inputs, there are many recipes that transform one or more resources into another. The resources that get used up in the creation process are the inputs. The more people work on a particular development, the more input resources they will use up.
     
  2. Outputs
    Every recipe creates resources. The amount of resources that are ouput can depend on the skills of the workers, the tech level of the recipe and the quality of the land being worked.
     
  3. Labour
    Every recipe has an amount of labour. Labour-intensive recipes can require as many as three people at a time to work together to create the output. Such a recipe will work well with three or six people, but poorly with five or seven. Recipes require a certain class of population to work. Generally, peasants lack the education of craftsmen, who in turn do not have the connections or schooling for millitary command or statesmanship.
     
  4. Land Quality
    It is more effective to hunt for ivory in the jungle, or fish by the sea. Certain recipes work better in some land types than others. 
     
  5. Technology
    Every recipe your people can put into practice is held in your library. The more you study a recipe, the better your people get at implementing it. Technology is more important for some recipes than others.

There are many ways to create food, directly form the land through fishing and hunting, or by processing animals and plants.
There are many ways to create food, directly form the land through fishing and hunting, or by processing animals and plants.
There are many ways to create food, directly form the land through fishing and hunting, or by processing animals and plants.
Rice is grown in plantations. Cultivating rice is labour-intensive and rice grows best in wetlands. It does well in jungles and can even be grown in limited amounts in forests.
Rice is grown in plantations. Cultivating rice is labour-intensive and rice grows best in wetlands. It does well in jungles and can even be grown in limited amounts in forests.
Rice is grown in plantations. Cultivating rice is labour-intensive and rice grows best in wetlands. It does well in jungles and can even be grown in limited amounts in forests.

From soupy dark swamps to salty marshes and river basins, wetlands are harsh terrain that are ideal for the cultivation of certain crops, are naturally irrigated for farming and have rich mineral deposits that can be mined. Farms built on wetlands take advantage of the plentiful water while mines tap below the thick mud and tar to find precious resources that can also be filtered out of the muck through panning. Plantations that cultivate special crops that thrive in murky conditions make wetlands an important specialised land type.

Farms built on wetlands take advantage of the plentiful water while mines tap below the thick mud and tar to find precious resources that can also be filtered out of the muck through panning. Plantations that cultivate special crops that thrive in murky conditions make wetlands an important specialised land type.

Plantations that cultivate special crops that thrive in murky conditions make wetlands an important specialised land type.

Dark, thick, crazy forests teeming with wild and dangerous animals, jungles are notoriously harsh terrain. The unkempt undergrowth can be replaced by plantations that utilise the incredibly rich soil to grow specialised produce. Jungle camps provide a base for hunters looking for elephants and monkeys. Jungles can also proove to be a rich source of mineral deposits that can be mined.

The unkempt undergrowth can be replaced by plantations that utilise the incredibly rich soil to grow specialised produce. Jungle camps provide a base for hunters looking for elephants and monkeys. Jungles can also proove to be a rich source of mineral deposits that can be mined.

The unkempt undergrowth can be replaced by plantations that utilise the incredibly rich soil to grow specialised produce. Jungle camps provide a base for hunters looking for elephants and monkeys. Jungles can also proove to be a rich source of mineral deposits that can be mined.

Atalaster, at the center of your concern is your people. Starting out with limited skills and knowhow, pay them to create goods for sale in the world market. They will spend the money that they earn to purchase goods from your store. With enough money for food they will not only survive, but reproduce and multiply. Their offspring, purely bred or mixed with foreign blood will enter the labour force looking for work in your lands and abroad.

 

If after they have eaten, they have enough money, they will also buy basic goods and luxuries from your store and maybe their children will grow up to be of a higher social standing than themselves. Pay your people generously, but make sure that collectively your finances are on a strong footing. Find the right trade-off between finding useful work for your people and finding skillful foreigners that will help fill your treasury.

 

Your people have various traits that makes them unique. This will make them more inclined to consume more of some goods and less of others. Although an individual's heritage might be composed of several diluted racial traits and religious beliefs, he will identify himself only with one group at a time. Several generations down the line, even only a 10% affilliation with your people might be an individual's most dominant identity.

The game was developed by William Borg Barthet. A software engineer with a passion for games and free markets. Having enjoyed browser-based games that involve a persistent world that moves in slow real time, I found myself inspired to create a gaming experience that was a little different. Most browser-based games bog down the pace of play and condition players through micro-rewards and ever increasing wait times to spend real money on buying premium shortcuts. These games are also focused around war and empire.

 

What I wanted in this game is to focus on trade, and have a real live price-mechanism determine what industries will be most profitable. Other games that involve trade have arbitrarily set prices or only a very rudimentary market system. Could a real, living price system find stability with hundreds of players trying to maximise their profits? If you want a real market simulator and a browser-based game with a simple interface, no ads and no grinding, you've found the right project.

 

The project is open source and can be found on GitHub.

 

The game engine is powered by Hippo CMS. An extremely versatile java open-source content management system.

 

The design was adapted from the Wilmette template produced by Type & Grids.

 

Several icons were downloaded from the Noun Project, including

 

  • rice by Marco Galtarossa from the Noun Project

  • Spartan by Joshua McMahan from the Noun Project

The game was developed by William Borg Barthet. A software engineer with a passion for games and free markets. Having enjoyed browser-based games that involve a persistent world that moves in slow real time, I found myself inspired to create a gaming experience that was a little different. Most browser-based games bog down the pace of play and condition players through micro-rewards and ever increasing wait times to spend real money on buying premium shortcuts. These games are also focused around war and empire.

 

What I wanted in this game is to focus on trade, and have a real live price-mechanism determine what industries will be most profitable. Other games that involve trade have arbitrarily set prices or only a very rudimentary market system. Could a real, living price system find stability with hundreds of players trying to maximise their profits? If you want a real market simulator and a browser-based game with a simple interface, no ads and no grinding, you've found the right project.

 

The project is open source and can be found on GitHub.

 

The game engine is powered by Hippo CMS. An extremely versatile java open-source content management system.

 

The design was adapted from the Wilmette template produced by Type & Grids.

 

Several icons were downloaded from the Noun Project, including
